data.question: What is the role of sodium cyanide in the synthesis of the cyano-bridged single-chain magnet?
data.answer: Sodium cyanide is added to the solution of [MnTPP(H2O)2]Cl in methyl cyanide to initiate the synthesis process.

data.question: Why were black plate-shaped crystals collected by evaporation?
data.answer: Black plate-shaped crystals were collected by evaporation after the dark green solution turned to dark brown and was kept in a dark place for several days.

data.question: Is the Mn–C bond distance in [MnIII(TPP)(CN)2] consistent with typical Mn–Ncyano bond distances?
What does the presence of ferromagnetic interaction and the unquenched orbital momentum of low-spin Mn(III) indicate about the wmT value at room temperature?
data.answer: The wmT value of 4.35 emu K mol-1 at room temperature being higher than the spin-only value indicates the presence of ferromagnetic interaction and the unquenched orbital momentum of low-spin Mn(III).

data.question: What is the best-fitting parameter J obtained from fitting the magnetic susceptibilities curve?
data.answer: The best-fitting parameter J obtained is +2.19 cm-1.

data.question: Does the linear Mn–NRC bonds favor ferromagnetic coupling?
What is the relaxation time t0 based on the Arrhenius relationship?
data.answer: The relaxation time t0 is 1.84 × 10-12 s.

data.question: What does the Cole–Cole plot at 2 and 2.5 K indicate about the relaxation processes?
data.answer: The Cole–Cole plot at 2 and 2.5 K indicates the presence of double relaxation processes.

data.question: Is the nearest inter-chain Mn–Mn separation in [Mn(salen)][Mn(salen)(CN)2] smaller than in complex 1?
What contributes to the observation of SCM behavior in complex 1?
data.answer: The linear structure, regular alignment of individual MnIII Jahn–Teller axes along the chain direction, and negligibly weak interchain magnetic coupling contribute to the SCM behavior in complex 1.

data.question: What is the yield of black plate-shaped single crystals based on [Mn(TPP)(H2O)2]ClO4?
Does the synthesis of the cyano-bridged SCM complex require the presence of [Mn(tpa)(H2O)2](ClO4)2?
What is the role of tris(2-pyridylmethyl)amine in the synthesis?
data.answer: Tris(2-pyridylmethyl)amine, when mixed with equivalent manganese(II) perchlorate in acetonitrile, helps stabilize the coordination of cyanides toward [Mn(TPP)]+, promoting the assembly into chains.

data.question: What is the significance of the Mn–C bond distances for [MnIII(TPP)(CN)2]?
data.answer: The Mn–C bond distances for [MnIII(TPP)(CN)2] are significant as they indicate the presence of two kinds of Mn(III) ions, as proved by the magnetic characterization.

data.question: Is the chain structure of complex 1 linear or zigzag?
Does the presence of double magnetic relaxations indicate a single relaxation process?
What does the fitting of the magnetic susceptibility curve with the alternating-spin chain model reveal?
data.answer: The fitting with the alternating-spin chain model reveals a parameter J = 3.75(6) cm-1, comparable to that of the Mn8 ring model.

data.question: What is the Deff value of complex 1?
data.answer: The Deff value of complex 1 is 45.3 K.

data.question: Are the magnetic properties of complex 1 related to its structural linearity?
What is the role of the Jahn–Teller effect in the ferromagnetic exchange interaction?
data.answer: The Jahn–Teller effect, by elongating the Mn–Ncyano bonds, reduces the p–p orbital overlap, weakening the antiferromagnetic contribution and favoring ferromagnetic exchange interaction.
